question: Pixie Dust Technologies, Inc. CES 2024 product highlight and specification

response.query: Pixie Dust Technologies, Inc. CES 2024 product highlight and specification

results.title: Introducing the concept of VUEVO smart glasses that ... - pixiedusttech.com
results.content: Pixie Dust Technologies, Inc. (Headquarters: Chuo-ku, Tokyo; Presidents: Yoichi Ochiai, Taiichiro Murakami, hereinafter "PxDT") will exhibit a concept of its VUEVO smart glasses model (hereinafter "VUEVO Smart Glasses") that visualizes conversations using proprietary acoustic processing technology at the Cellid, Inc. booth at CES 2024 in Las Vegas, USA from January 9th to 12th, 2024.
results.raw_content:
NEWS
Introducing the concept of VUEVO smart glasses that visualize conversations using unique sound processing technology at CES 2024.
Pixie Dust Technologies, Inc. (Headquarters: Chuo-ku, Tokyo; Presidents: Yoichi Ochiai, Taiichiro Murakami, hereinafter "PxDT") will exhibit a concept of its VUEVO smart glasses model (hereinafter "VUEVO Smart Glasses") that visualizes conversations using proprietary acoustic processing technology at the Cellid, Inc. booth at CES 2024 in Las Vegas, USA from January 9th to 12th, 2024. Visitors to the booth will be able to experience these VUEVO Smart Glasses.
About VUEVO smart glasses
VUEVO Smart Glasses is a product that visualizes conversations using unique sound processing technology and uses VUEVO microphones and applications（https://vuevo.net/）to support communication with people who have hearing impairments, difficulties, or are foreign language speakers. It is a product that applies technology to smart glasses.
For the user interface, a technology was adopted to display the contents of the speech in real time near the speaker, which can be seen through the smart glasses, similar to a cartoon speech bubble. This allows you to intuitively recognize who spoke what.
The lens uses Cellid's Waveguide display with a wide viewing angle, enabling smooth communication with a comprehensive display range.
Exhibition place of VUEVO
Name ：CES 2024
Dates ：Tuesday, January 9, 2024 - Friday, January 12, 2024 (US time)
Exhibition location ：North Hall, #9068 Cellid booth, Convention Center, Las Vegas, USA
About CES
CES, which has been held since 1967, was once an exhibition focusing on home appliances, but now it is held in Las Vegas, USA, every January as one of the world's largest technology events. CES 2023, which was held in earnest after the corona crisis, was exhibited by approximately 3,200 companies and visited by approximately 117,000 people.
https://www.ces.tech/
About other exhibitions
PxDT will also exhibit a transparent sound-absorbing panel "iwasemi™ RC-α" that uses acoustic metamaterial technology at CES 2024.
・ Release about iwasemi's exhibition
https://pixiedusttech.com/news/news_20231201/
About Cellid
Cellid's core business is the development of AR glasses displays modules, mainly waveguide and spatial recognition engines for next-generation devices. Cellid's unique optical simulation technology and proprietary production technology have enabled the development of display modules that are as thin and light as ordinary eyeglass lenses, with clear images and one of the world's largest field of view for waveguides. Cellid also develops and provides industry-specific solutions using spatial recognition software technologies such as Cellid SLAM. By combining AR display hardware technology and real-world spatial recognition software technology, we are accelerating "Blending the Physical and Digital Worlds," and leading the realization of extraordinary information tools that are more accessible and convenient for humans.
Company Name ：Cellid, Inc.
Establishment ：October 2016
CEO ：Satoshi Shiraga
Location ：Pacific Capital Plaza 5F, 4-8-6 Roppongi, Minato-ku, Tokyo
US Rep office: 100 S. Murphy Avenue, Satellite Sunnyvale, Sunnyvale, CA
Funding ：Approx. 2.3 billion yen (as of December 2023 Series B)
https://cellid.com/en/
Inquiries regarding this matter
Pixie Dust Technologies, Inc. PR team
Contact : https://pixiedusttech.com/contact/
- VUEVO and related logos are trademarks or registered trademarks of Pixie Dust Technologies, Inc..

results.title: In commemoration of winning the "CES® 2024 Innovation Awards" at the ...
results.content: Pixie Dust Technologies, Inc. (Headquarters: Chuo-ku, Tokyo; Presidents: Yoichi Ochiai, Taiichiro Murakami hereinafter referred to as "PxDT") exhibited a transparent sound absorbing material "iwasemi™ RC-α" that harmonizes with glass at CES 2024 held in Las Vegas, USA from January 9 to 12, 2024. ... More than 3000 products were applied for ...
results.raw_content:
NEWS
In commemoration of winning the “CES® 2024 Innovation Awards” at the world’s largest tech event “CES 2024”, the largest installation support campaign for the “world’s first” transparent acoustic metamaterial sound absorbing material “iwasemi™RC-α” has started. Half of the number of installations is free with the installation of more than 3 meeting rooms.
Pixie Dust Technologies, Inc. (Headquarters: Chuo-ku, Tokyo; Presidents: Yoichi Ochiai, Taiichiro Murakami hereinafter referred to as "PxDT") exhibited a transparent sound absorbing material "iwasemi™ RC-α" that harmonizes with glass at CES 2024 held in Las Vegas, USA from January 9 to 12, 2024. We won the "CES 2024 Innovation Awards," which are given to particularly highly acclaimed products. In commemoration of the award, we will extend the existing limited-time campaign and start a more advantageous campaign.
Campaign overview
We will start a campaign to support the installation of "iwasemi™ RC-α" and "iwasemi™ SQ-α" on January 17, 2024. In this campaign, if you install more than 3 meeting rooms, half of the number of installations will be free.
Period: Wednesday, January 17, 2024 until the end of March*
Contents: For customers who install "iwasemi™ RC-α" and "iwasemi™ SQ-α" for more than 3 meeting rooms, we will charge half of the number of installed tickets for free.
* The implementation period will be limited to projects whose installation will be completed by the end of March 2024.
* We will calculate the optimal number and estimated amount according to the size of the conference room.
The campaign will only be applied to customers who agree to our quotation.
* Layout design and installation costs will be discussed separately.
* We will calculate the optimal number and estimated amount according to the size of the conference room.
"iwasemi™ RC-α" series installation support campaign usage example and voice of installing companies
Case 1：
Toyota Connected Corporation
Comments：
Until now, there was no sound-absorbing panel that could be attached to glass, so I was worried about countermeasures.
iwasemi RC-α can be attached to glass and the unit is small and the design can be freely assembled.
We were able to take measures against the sound of the glass-walled conference room without destroying the design of the office space.
After installation, you no longer have to worry about the reverberation in the conference room, making it easier to hold face-to-face meetings as well as web conferences.
Case 2：
Tokyo Midtown Yaesu
Comments：
We installed iwasemi in a private room meeting room in the innovation co-creation space (business lounge).
Since it is not a space used only by specific companies, it is important that the voice in the conference room does not leak outside.
Thanks to its high sound absorption performance, smooth communication is created under a wonderful acoustic environment.
In addition, the design is high, and the texture of the space has improved.
About iwasemi™
iwasemi™ is a sound absorbing material developed by applying PxDT's unique sound absorbing design technology to acoustic metamaterial technology. iwasemi™ sound absorbing material has the following three characteristics.
1. Flexibility of sound absorption frequency characteristics
In principle, general sound absorbing materials such as glass wool have the property that the sound absorption rate increases as the band goes to a high band. On the other hand, iwasemi™ can achieve flexible sound absorption frequency characteristics according to the application scene, such as the property that the sound absorption rate increases only in a specific frequency band and the property that the sound absorption rate is uniformly high from low band to high band.
2. High sound absorption and thinning
In order to increase the sound absorption rate with general sound absorbing materials, it is necessary to thicken the sound absorbing material.
On the other hand, iwasemi™ can increase the sound absorption rate without thickening the sound absorbing material. In other words, thinning can be achieved while maintaining the sound absorption coefficient equivalent to that of general sound absorbing materials.
3. High degree of freedom in material selection and processing freedom
Common sound absorbing materials are porous structures such as glass or wool. Therefore, the design and strength are limited.
On the other hand, iwasemi™ uses a resonance structure, so various materials (e.g. ABS (photo: left), stainless steel (photo: center), acrylic (photo: right)) can be used to achieve high sound absorption. As a result, it is possible to realize sound absorbing materials that take into consideration design such as color variations including transparent colors and texture expressions by surface treatment, and sound absorbing materials with high strength. In addition, since the sound absorbing material can be molded integrally with the applied product, it can contribute to improving the strength and weight of the applied product.
Related articles：https://pixiedusttech.com/technologies/iwasemi/
"iwasemi™ RC-α" blends into the space
"iwasemi™ RC-α" is a sound absorbing material that can be attached to glass. The transparent sound-absorbing panel is unparalleled in the world, and has been successfully developed with acoustic metamaterial technology and unique design technology.
Plastic is used as the raw material, and by achieving high transparency that blends in with glass, the problem of sound in the workspace is efficiently solved while maintaining the sense of freedom and design of the glass. In addition, a sound-absorbing structure specialized for human voices suppresses the echo sound that haunts the glass space, and at the same time, various layout patterns can be created for tiles. The fluctuating shape on the surface of the main unit has a blindfold function, and can be used not only for sound absorption but also as a privacy measure for conference rooms. There is also the benefit of using plant-derived bioengineered plastics, which can contribute to reducing environmental impact.
Related article：https://pixiedusttech.com/product/iwasemi/rc-a/
"iwasemi™ SQ-α" for an eye-catching and sound-catching space
"iwasemi™ SQ-α" is a sound absorbing material that has acquired a new design expression that can be painted hard.
As with the iwasemiTM RC-α, we have applied acoustic metamaterial technology to achieve high design and sound absorption performance. In the case of "I want to give a sense of dignity" or "I want to add an accent to the design", the sound environment can be improved and the ideal office environment can be achieved in terms of design.
Related article：https://pixiedusttech.com/product/iwasemi/sq-a/
About CES 2024
CES, which has been held since 1967, was once an exhibition focusing on home appliances, but now it is held in Las Vegas, USA, every January as one of the world's largest technology events.
More than 3000 products were applied for the 2024 CES Innovation Awards, of which 522 were awarded.
Official site：https://www.ces.tech/
Name：CES 2024
Dates：Tuesday, January 9, 2024 - Friday, January 12, 2024 (US time)
Venue：Eureka Park Booth7, Venetian 1F, Las Vegas, USA
What is acoustic metamaterial technology?
Metamaterials are a general term for artificial substances that behave in ways that are not found in nature by imparting a fine periodic shape below the wavelength to a substance. By applying this concept to the field of sound waves, acoustic metamaterial technology is a technology that generates substances with acoustic characteristics that are not found in nature.
Reference: Acoustic Metamaterials Market Trends
Acoustic metamaterial technology can be used in various fields such as air conditioning, building materials, equipment, railways, construction, automobiles, aviation / space, home appliances, and industrial equipment because it is possible to have arbitrary soundproofing performance with lightweight and thin materials. The market size of acoustic metamaterials in Japan in 2023 is expected to be about 1.7 billion yen.
In addition, the market size is expected to reach 56.1 billion yen in 2035, and it is expected to be adopted in the fields of architecture, automobiles, aerospace, and medical devices in the future.
(Reference: Fuji Keizai Co., Ltd. "Survey on the acoustic metamaterial market expected as a next-generation soundproofing material")
Inquiries about this matter
Pixie Dust Technologies, Inc. PR team
Contact：https://pixiedusttech.com/contact
*iwasemi and related logos are trademarks or registered trademarks of Pixie Dust Technologies, Inc.

results.title: Pixie Dust Technologies, Inc. to Exhibit at CES 2024 iwasemi™ RC-α wins ...
results.content: In addition to attending CES 2024, Pixie's transparent sound-absorbing panel iwasemi™ RC-α will be receiving the coveted Innovation Award, which is given to products that are recognized as leaders in the "Home Appliances" category.
results.raw_content:
NEWS
Pixie Dust Technologies, Inc. to Exhibit at CES 2024 iwasemi™ RC-α wins CES 2024 Innovation Award
New York, NY and Tokyo, Japan, December 4, 2023 – Pixie Dust Technologies, Inc. (Nasdaq: PXDT) (the “Company”), a Japanese technology company focused on commercializing innovative products and materials utilizing proprietary wave technology, today announced that it will exhibit at the Eureka Park Japan Pavilion at CES 2024, which will be held in Las Vegas, USA from January 9 to 12, 2024.
In addition to attending CES 2024, Pixie's transparent sound-absorbing panel iwasemi™ RC-α will be receiving the coveted Innovation Award, which is given to products that are recognized as leaders in the "Home Appliances" category.
iwasemi™ RC-α, which uses acoustic metamaterial technology, is a transparent sound absorbing material that can be attached to glass. In addition to a rectangular shape that allows various patterns to be created like tiles, it is equipped with a fluctuating process to protect privacy in the room. By using plant-derived bioplastic as the material, the Company has reduced its environmental impact and increased transparency. iwasemi™ RC-α blends into any space, creating a quiet environment that allows for conversation.
About CES
CES, which has been held since 1967, was once an exhibition focusing on home appliances, but now it is held in Las Vegas, USA, every January as one of the world's largest technology events. Approximately 117,000 people attended CES 2023.
Pixie Dust Technologies Investor Relations Contact:
Email: PXDT_IR@pixiedusttech.com
Gateway Group, Inc.
John Yi and Luke Johnson
Email: pixie@gateway-grp.com

Pixie Dust Technologies, Inc. to Exhibit at CES 2024
iwasemi™ RC-a wins CES 2024 Innovation Award
NEW YORK and TOKYO, Dec. 4, 2023 /PRNewswire/ - Pixie Dust Technologies, Inc. (Nasdaq: PXDT) (the "Company"), a Japanese technology company focused on commercializing innovative products and materials utilizing proprietary wave technology, today announced that it will exhibit at the Eureka Park Japan Pavilion at CES 2024, which will be held in Las Vegas, USA from January 9 to 12, 2024.
In addition to attending CES 2024, Pixie's transparent sound-absorbing panel iwasemi™ RC-a will be receiving the coveted Innovation Award, which is given to products that are recognized as leaders in the "Home Appliances" category.
iwasemi™ RC-a, which uses acoustic metamaterial technology, is a transparent sound absorbing material that can be attached to glass. In addition to a rectangular shape that allows various patterns to be created like tiles, it is equipped with a fluctuating process to protect privacy in the room. By using plant-derived bioplastic as the material, the Company has reduced its environmental impact and increased transparency. iwasemi™ RC-a blends into any space, creating a quiet environment that allows for conversation.
CES, which has been held since 1967, was once an exhibition focusing on home appliances, but now it is held in Las Vegas, USA, every January as one of the world's largest technology events. Approximately 117,000 people attended CES 2023.
Pixie Dust Technologies, Inc. is a Japanese technology company focused on commercializing innovative products and materials utilizing proprietary wave technology. The Company is currently focusing on two areas of product development: (1) "Personal Care & Diversity", where wave control technology is applied to mechanobiology and intervention/assistance in vision, hearing, and touch, and (2) "Workspace & Digital Transformation," where metamaterials (technology that creates properties through structure rather than material) and solutions to commercial design problems, such as in offices or construction sites, are applied.

Pixie Dust Technologies, Inc. to Exhibit at CES 2024 (PR Newswire)
Pixie Dust Technologies, Inc. to Exhibit at CES 2024
PR Newswire
NEW YORK and TOKYO, Dec. 4, 2023
iwasemi™ RC-α wins CES 2024 Innovation Award
NEW YORK and TOKYO
,
Dec. 4, 2023
/PRNewswire/ - Pixie Dust Technologies, Inc.
(Nasdaq: PXDT)
(the
" Company"),  a Japanese technology company focused on commercializing innovative products and materials utilizing proprietary wave technology, today announced that it will exhibit at the Eureka Park Japan Pavilion at CES 2024, which will be held in Las Vegas , USA from January 9 to 12, 2024 .
In addition to attending CES 2024, Pixie's transparent sound-absorbing panel iwasemi™ RC-α will be receiving the coveted Innovation Award, which is given to products that are recognized as leaders in the "Home Appliances" category.
iwasemi™ RC-α, which uses acoustic metamaterial technology, is a transparent sound absorbing material that can be attached to glass. In addition to a rectangular shape that allows various patterns to be created like tiles, it is equipped with a fluctuating process to protect privacy in the room. By using plant-derived bioplastic as the material, the Company has reduced its environmental impact and increased transparency. iwasemi™ RC-α blends into any space, creating a quiet environment that allows for conversation.
CES , which has been held since 1967, was once an exhibition focusing on home appliances, but now it is held in Las Vegas , USA , every January as one of the world's largest technology events. Approximately 117,000 people attended CES 2023.
Pixie Dust Technologies, Inc. is a Japanese technology company focused on commercializing innovative products and materials utilizing proprietary wave technology. The Company is currently focusing on two areas of product development: (1) "Personal Care & Diversity", where wave control technology is applied to mechanobiology and intervention/assistance in vision, hearing, and touch, and (2) "Workspace & Digital Transformation," where metamaterials (technology that creates properties through structure rather than material) and solutions to commercial design problems, such as in offices or construction sites, are applied.
